meanings.definition: A hormone secreted by the adrenal glands in response to stress or excitement.
meanings.sent1: When I saw the spider, my adrenalin kicked in, and I ran away quickly.
meanings.sent2: The adrenalin rush from the roller coaster made me feel alive and energized.
meanings.sent3: My adrenalin must have mistaken the math test for a lion, making my heart race.
meanings.sent4: Her adrenalin was a fierce warrior, ready to battle any fear that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The adrenalin surge was like a sudden lightning bolt, jolting me into action.

meanings.definition: A synthetic form of the hormone epinephrine, used as a drug to stimulate the heart and improve blood flow.
meanings.sent1: The doctor administered adrenalin to the patient to help with the allergic reaction.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, adrenalin can be a life-saving medication to restore heart function.
meanings.sent3: The adrenalin injection turned the sleepy cat into a hyperactive furball.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a dose of adrenalin, propelling him forward with renewed vigor.
meanings.sent5: The adrenalin shot was a superhero swooping in to rescue the failing heart.
